content.description:
Start with left hand on good crimp and right hand on good undercling jug and climb up.

Same route as El Chorizo, but doesn’t use the chockstone as a foot hold.

Start with a right hand on the lower rail, left hand on the upper rail, work up the rail then make a long lock off to the lip not dabbing on the boulder behind you.  This problem would be a better if it wasnt for having to watch your back from hitting the boulder.
content.location: From the base of the arete slab, head right and scramble down boulders (South) passing the warm up slab on its right.  The boulder sits above a cave and can be hard to see.

content.description: Start on the right jug (a lower start may go starting deeper under the roof using the crack at a harder grade). Make a big move out left and work your way up the "knuckle" with compression, with difficulty up top as the cracks begin to flare.
content.location: In the lower area below aid hill. If your facing Washed Out, go directly to the right along the same contour about 20' (over a boulder or two) and you should see it.

content.description:
Start left hand on a good crimp on the arete, right hand on a small side pull. Pull on and make delicate moves on small holds to jugs at the lip.   Definitely helps to be tall!

Time will tell for the grade, shorter climbers will have to own up on some of the smaller holds or make a jump to the top.
content.protection: Spotter and a couple pads protect the sharp corner behind the landing.
content.location: Follow directions to "No Fat Chicks" and follow the trail down the hill to the 5.7 Arete Slab, skirt the left side of the boulder (climbers right) down the hill. Walk to the right passing Washed Out and into a pit.  The problem is on the left.

content.description: Start with the left hand on a good crimp, and right hand low in an undercling.  A block on the right may provide useful in starting the problem.  Pull on and work the right hand up a series of underclings then big move left hand to the lip.  Textbook mantel.
content.location: From the base of the arete slab, walk left into the pit passing Lost and Losing and scramble up the hill.
